poem:
Title: Only a Fraction

A single percentage laid bare,
In the democracy's green and public square.
War's heavy quilt draped on few,
The many unacquainted with its hue.
The absent touch, a gap profound,
A hollow echo from battleground.
In hearts of home, let empathy dwell,
All ears leaned for the distant bell.
That appendage of war, let it not wane, 
America, hold gently its refrain.
